sage.camera

Class JOGLCamera

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.camera.AbstractCamera
      • sage.camera.JOGLCamera
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICamera

    public class JOGLCamera
extends AbstractCamera
implements ICamera
    Class JOGLCamera provides an implementation of the ICamera interface using the JOGL Java interface to OpenGL. This implementation relies on parent class AbstractCamera to provide accessors/mutators for the camera parameters (location, UVN orientation, view volume parameters, and the corresponding isOutOfDate flag indicating whether or not the current camera object state matches that of the underlying OpenGL camera.
    Author:
    John Clevenger

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void applySettings()
      Updates the GLContext for the drawable (canvas) in the associated IRenderer to match the current camera settings.
      boolean intersects(BoundingVolume bv)
      This method is intended to be overridden by camera implementation subclasses in a way that returns a boolean indicating whether the specified BoundingVolume intersects the currently-defined camera view volume.
      boolean isOutOfDate()
      Returns a flag indicating whether the camera settings are "out of date", meaning that the settings have been changed but the new settings have not yet been transferred to the OpenGL context associated with the drawable component (Canvas) in the Renderer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JOGLCamera

        public JOGLCamera(IRenderer renderer)
        Constructs a JOGLCamera associated with the specified IRenderer. The default values for the camera are
        • location = (0,0,1)
        • U = {1,0,0}
        • V = {0,1,0}
        • N = {0,0,-1}
        All other camera parameters have default values as specified by AbstractCamera.AbstractCamera(IRenderer).
        Parameters:
        renderer - - the renderer to which this JOGLCamera is attached

    • Method Detail

      • applySettings

        public void applySettings()
        Updates the GLContext for the drawable (canvas) in the associated IRenderer to match the current camera settings.
        Specified by:
        applySettings in interface ICamera
        Overrides:
        applySettings in class AbstractCamera

      • isOutOfDate

        public boolean isOutOfDate()
        Returns a flag indicating whether the camera settings are "out of date", meaning that the settings have been changed but the new settings have not yet been transferred to the OpenGL context associated with the drawable component (Canvas) in the Renderer.
        Specified by:
        isOutOfDate in interface ICamera
        Overrides:
        isOutOfDate in class AbstractCamera
        Returns:
        true if the camera settings have not been applied to OpenGL; false otherwise

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(BoundingVolume bv)
        Description copied from class: AbstractCamera
        This method is intended to be overridden by camera implementation subclasses in a way that returns a boolean indicating whether the specified BoundingVolume intersects the currently-defined camera view volume. The implementation of this method in AbstractCamera is empty and throws a RuntimeException if invoked.
        Specified by:
        intersects in interface ICamera
        Overrides:
        intersects in class AbstractCamera
        Parameters:
        bv - The BoundingVolume to compare against the view frustum
        Returns:
        true if the BoundingVolume intersects the view frustum
